entry.content:
We believe that technology is nothing but a lever. Technology is not justice, technology is not equity, technology will not save us. Technology can help us do our work in a more secure, inclusive, and hopefully egalitarian way.

Our vision is to be a support and resource to organizations and individuals who hope to leverage technology in the way envisioned above.

Currently, as a consulting practice of one, we must take a boutique approach to clients and, if we aren't a right fit, we'd be glad to recommend someone we know.

Contact us if you'd like to explore a new and holistic approach to technology, data stewardship, and digital security.

entry.content:
Ken Montenegro supports social movements using his skills as both a technologist and lawyer.

He has been practicing technology with nonprofits for close to 20 years. Those 20 years encompass research, planning, implementation, and evaluation of technology solutions. Ken has performed this work as both a staff member and consultant.

Ken has a law degree. He provides a unique insight that attempts to help organizations have meaningful conversations about the nexus of ethical, statutory, and practical data use and retention.

Ken is a board member of the Nonprofit Technology Network; the Immigrant Defenders Law Center; and is National Vice-President of the National Lawyers Guild. He is also a co-founder of the Stop LAPD Spying Coalition.

Current services are focused on delivering limited facilitation, training, strategy, and planning services to nonprofits. Due to capacity, we must limit our engagements.

If you’d like to talk, please contact Ken: he’d love to hear about what you’re working on and hopefully collaborate. To view Ken's resume, click here. Ken also enjoys reading and listening to music.

entry.content:
A retainer equal to 20% of estimated project total is required to initiate work; hourly work is due net-15 days after hours are worked. Payments made after the 15th day are penalized at a reasonable rate.

Commercial/Not Nonprofit:

    $210/hour unless pricing arranged by contract

Nonprofit Over $3M Annual Budget:

    $185/hour unless pricing arranged by contract

Nonprofit Less Than $3M Annual Budget:

    $165/hour unless pricing arranged by contract

Project/contract scope price:

    Beyond half-hour, $80/hour

entry.content:
If you would like to talk, we'd be glad to make time. Our largest available slot is Thursday. Our schedule is largely Pacific time.

Email:  kmontenegro at tutanota.com (longest response time)

Wire:  @kmontenegro (medium)

Twitter:  @kmontenegro (fast)

No PGP/GPG?!? Yes, without training, support, and care, it's easy for folks to mess up using key-based encrypted email. I'm a strong supporter of end-to-end encrypted email provider Tutanota as it provides practical security, much as Signal does for SMS/text messaging.
